1121.content:
((Note: Saturn and Chibi-Moon are in their late teens, and everyone else is college age...))

"Well..." Luna said to the nine gathered Sailor Senshi, Chibi Usa and Tuxedo Mask sitting nearby as well, everyone in their human identities. She coughed, looked at Artemis for encouragement, the white cat nodding to her and smiling. She sighed, and turned back to the gathered heroes and continued. "I have good news, better news, bad news, worse news, and utterly strange news. Which would you like to hear first?"

The Senshi all looked at each other worriedly for several moments before Tuxedo Mask said, "Why don't you give the news to us in the order you said it."

Luna sighed, and nodded. "Very well. First, the good news: I have found out a way for all of you to come back from the dead that's guaranteed to work every single time."

The Senshi all began to talk amongst themselves, pleased looks coming to their faces.

"Well... A bit depressing, but considering how many times we've died, that's good to know," Sailor Mars said after a few moments.

Luna, encouraged, decided to continue. "The better news is that with this new method, which is actually a spell formula that I encoded into your drinks that will restore your bodies completely after death, will make you more powerful each time you resurrect, which should be a fairly quick process."

Everyone looked down at their drinks in surprise. Liking the idea, they all eagerly drank their respective drinks in a single gulp.

Mercury licked her lips curiously. "Taste was off. And I feel a slight tingle in my stomach. Is that the formula?"

Luna nodded. "Artemis, Diana and I have already consumed the formula."

Tuxedo Mask chuckled. "Well, might as well get with the bad news."

Luna grimaced. "The bad news is that there's a demonic force heading for Earth that will be here in three years."

Everyone froze, staring at Luna with alarmed expressions.

Luna shook her head sadly. "The worse news is that we won't be strong enough to defeat him by then. Creating enhancements for everyone's powers would take too long, and we've eliminated every threat strong enough to force enough resurrections to enhance our powers enough."

"There has to be something we can do!" Sailor Moon almost wailed, "We can't just sit here and let this thing kill us!!"

"There is... one possibility," Luna said, "But it's rather... bizarre..."

"Tell us!" Mars said, "At this point we'll take anything!"

Luna looked to Artemis and then sighed, shaking her head and saying, "Kill each other. Repeatedly. Several dozen times over. Tuxedo Mask could conceivably be excused from this, since his powers are connected to Sailor Moon's and he grows stronger with her, and it would be prudent to have someone around to make sure nothing goes wrong... Plus all of you are more powerful than he is anyway..."

Everyone stared at Luna incredulously. "Um..." Sailor Moon said, "As much as Rei and I would like to blast each other into moondust at times... I really don't think I'd like getting blasted or gutted or poisoned so many times..."

"Which brings us to the bizarre news," Artemis said, "We've found something that might make this a bit easier. But it's just as bizarre."

"It can't be more bizarre than having to kill each other repeatedly to get stronger. It's messy, it's hard to cover up, it's..."

"It can be solved by cooking and eating each other instead of using your powers on each other," Luna said.

Everyone stared at Luna in numb shock. Luna sighed. "I only wish I was kidding..."

Everyone just stared at her, unable to speak for a long moment.

"You're suggesting..." Mercury stated, "That we get stronger through the multi-ressurect method... By eating each other..."

Luna sighed again. "I know it's strange, but after looking through several alternate realities we've found methods to make it not only painless but pleasurable."

Moon blinked. "Luna, how many times will we have to die to get strong enough?"

Luna and Artemis traded pained looks and gave them the abnormally large number.

Everyone in the room promptly facefaulted and pratfell.

"Merciful Buddah..." Mars said.

"Indeed," Mercury said, "Barring the utter strangeness of it, if we eat each other that many times, we'll be incredibly FAT by the time that the menace gets here!"

"I'm open to better suggestions..." Luna sighed, "Believe me, I'm open to better suggestions."

No one said anything for a long time, each one slowly admitting they had nothing better to think of and coming to terms with the idea.


"So..." Jupiter said, "I guess we officially become cannibals, then..."

Moon nodded, sighing and cuddling up to Tuxedo Mask. "I guess so," she said.

Uranus, after a moment, chuckled and hugged Neptune. "Well, I've always enjoyed eating pussy. I guess this is just a natural extension of it."

Neptune blushed and buried her head in her lover's chest, both to hide her embarrassment and stifle her laughter. Saturn and Chibi-Moon both looked pained, while most of the others gave Uranus looks ranging from amused to annoyed.

"So how shall we go about this?" Venus asked, wanting to change the subject.

In terms of appearance, he was quite normal-looking, but still fairly attractive, with a head of black hair, soft brown eyes, and a kind welcoming face. His figure was a rather average six feet tall with a decent amount of muscle on him, and his wardrobe was simple shirts and pants, nothing too fancy. He was a perfectly pleasant person to talk to, always kind and willing to lend an ear to people for them to talk about their problems, but he didn't go out of his way to be actively social. He was content with his lot in life and the friends he had, and he had a job that he enjoyed. The only really noteworthy thing about the guy that most people ever noticed was his metabolism - every once in a while, he would abruptly pack on the pounds, his clothes straining to fit him until he managed to work off the weight in a frenzy of intense physical activity. But beyond that, there really wasn't anything particularly extraordinary about Mr. Kurusu, and that was exactly how he liked it.

Of course, what nobody else knew about the raven-haired young man was how he suddenly jumped up in weight.

Lurking beneath Kimihito's charming personality was the cunning mind of a predator, and a particularly gluttonous one at that. While he could keep his appetite under control for the most part, there would come a time every couple of months or so that the charming predator slipped out into the night, prowling the streets of his city for a very specific kind of prey - human women. ...And then a tall leggy lady clad in a business suit and dark glasses showed up at his door with several pieces of paperwork; a voluptuous red-haired young woman clutched a suitcase in her hands and stood shyly behind her, with snake-like pupils and smooth red scales along her cheeks, over her pointed ears, and covering the 20-foot-long serpent's tail that she had in the place of her legs. From the sounds of it, the woman, who went by the name of Ms. Smith, was looking for volunteers to take part in an exchange program for the recently-made public liminal species, and he had been found to be an ideal candidate for the position. Kimihito had taken quite an interest in the reveal of these extraspecies races when their existence was first revealed to the world, curious about the taste of their women... but having a lovely Lamia woman literally brought to his doorstep, and the opportunity to have even more homestays brought in to form a literal larder of gorgeous exotic treats, all paid for by the government?

Simba crouched in the bushes, donning a simple loincloth, letting his fur camouflage him among the dry grass. He was almost completely invisible as he scoped out his prey, feeling like he was in his natural element as a wild hunter

There were many things about hunting that frustrated him. After all, if everything the light touches belongs to them, why don’t the gazelle and the wildebeest and all those just offer themselves up to be eaten? But no, his father always says, that would disrupt the natural way of things. That would be tyranny! If they were going to devour that prey, they were going to have to capture that prey fair and square, the way their ancestors did.

His second frustration about hunting; he never got to do it! The lionesses seem to go out and catch the prey for the pride, and by the time he actually sees the meat they bring back, it’s already been cut up and cooked. His father tells him that male lions shouldn’t worry about hunting, they should worry about running the kingdom, improving their relationship with the other animals, and defending the pride.

Well, he’s tired of that! He’s bored of lounging around the pride rock all day, and he wants to try something new and exciting. He’s big and strong enough now that he feels confident he could take down the average herbivore. Indeed, today, he’s decided he’s going to find out what raw meat tastes like for the first time, and prove to himself that he’s capable of hunting just as well as the lionesses can. After all, if he can’t hunt a measly antelope, what good will he be as king?

Speaking of which, just down the hill from him, there’s a petite impala woman sitting beneath one of those big, weird trees, enjoying some baobab fruit. She looked like she’d be easy to catch. On the other hand, there was a tall, curvaceous zebra woman wandering a nearby field, who looked like she had some more meat on her bones.

As he continued to scan the field, he noticed something odd… a hyena woman? What is she doing out here? He’s immediately outraged that the hyena would have to gal to set foot on the pride lands! He ought to teach her a lesson! On the other hand, she would probably be the most difficult to catch, and her sharp fangs sort of scared him...
12121122.title: On the Prowl

121211221.content:
His heart flutters as he sneaks low through the grass, his tail swaying behind him. Today’s the day! He’s finally going to prove himself! He’s finally going to see what it’s like to hunt for prey, just like lions are meant to do! He felt like the most clever predator in the world as he snuck up on the completely oblivious impala, completely evading her sight. This is going to be perfect! She’s going to be delicious!

Suddenly, though, his heart sunk. That hyena woman who seems to be trespassing on the lands also seems to have her eyes locked on the oblivious impala! They were both creeping towards the impala from opposite sides, while the young woman enjoyed her fruit, completely oblivious to the two predators approaching him. Simba was starting to panic. If the hyena got to her first, it would completely ruin everything!

He grit his teeth, trying to move faster while still not getting seen… but the hyena was a more experienced predator. Just as the Simba was about to make it, the hyena leaped out of the bushes, trying to pounce on the impala woman! Only by some miracle did the impala barely dodge the hyena’s pounce. She let out a frantic squeal as she sprinted away from the hyena… and ended up running straight towards Simba!

Not wanting to get trampled, he stood up, raising his hands out in front of him… but it was too late. The impala was sprinting at full speed in a blind fit of fear, and she wasn’t going to let anything stop her, not even a lion! She tried to push him aside… but instead, she accidentally ran right into him at full speed, the lion getting flown backwards like a ragdoll by the sheer force that slammed into him…

His head slammed against the ground when he landed, further disorienting him. His vision was blurry, and his entire body felt… weird. Like, on the inside. Like there was something… filling him. He tried to let out a groan, but he realized his mouth was completely blocked by something. As his eyes adjusted and his confusion faded away, he quickly realized what had happened.

There was a pair of kicking legs dangling from his mouth! Apparently, the impala had accidentally launched herself headlong down his throat, and now only her butt and legs were sticking out from his maw. He could feel her torso stretching his esophagus to the limit, and he head and shoulders entering into the warm, acidic chamber of his stomach. He was immediately stunned, wondering just what on Earth was happening?

How could this be possible? He’d never heard of a lion’s mouth or stomach stretching out like this before! Heck, lions like to CHEW their food, thank you very much! Maybe a hippo had a mouth big enough to swallow somebody, but he didn’t! For crying out loud, the impala woman was TALLER than he was! He let out a whimper as her hips stretched out his jaws to their absolute limit, making his mouth incredibly sore.

He grabbed the impala woman’s legs, trying to pull them out… but no good. His powerful esophagus seemed to have a mind of its own, the muscles undulating rhythmically around as it very slowly pulled her deeper and deeper into his throat. Whenever he tries to pull her out, they just stubbornly clamp down, forbidding it. He could go get help… but he didn’t want to walk around with her legs hanging out of his mouth!

Soon, it was obvious that the only option he had was to finish swallowing her. After all, this was sort of her fault anyway… she DID run into him, which is what sent her partway down his throat in the first place. Besides, her body was blocking his throat at his point, which was making it difficult to breathe. With a sigh, he reluctantly took the biggest gulp he could, pulling the impala’s thighs and butt into his throat.

His throat muscles were pulling her deeper all on their own, but each gulp he took sped up the process dramatically. Feeling his body stretch out so much like this… well, it was weirdest thing he’s ever felt, but it wasn’t entirely unpleasant. It was like stuffing yourself full of the biggest meal in the world, all at once. And, indeed, he couldn’t help but notice; she was absolutely delicious! After all, you can’t get meat that’s more fresh than this!

With each gulp, her legs were pulled a few more inches into his throat. When he reached her knees, she couldn’t even kick anymore… and soon, all she could do was wriggle her toes as her feet dangling from his lips. Soon, he just slurped her feet up into his maw, sending her entire body down into the tight confines of his throat. He gasped for fresh air now that his throat wasn’t being blocked anymore.

“Oooohhhh…” He let out a loud groan, as the impala woman was forcibly pressed into his belly. Her body was curled up incredibly tight inside his stomach, and he can clearly see the outline of her body bulging out the front of his fluffy belly. His belly was now almost bigger than the rest of his entire body! He’s never felt so full before in his life! He let out a content sigh as he rubbed his hands over the sensitive, distended skin, the sense of fullness almost overpowering.

Meanwhile, the impala is more confused than even the lion himself! She was running from some hyena, when all of a sudden, she found herself someplace so incredibly dark, warm, and tight. She tried her best to struggle, but it quickly become obvious that she wasn’t going to be able to move a single muscle in here. “W-what the…?” Her muffled voice can faintly be heard from his belly. “Where am I? What is this?”

He groaned, straining his head up to look at his giant gut. To think that there’s somebody actually alive, all curled up in there… it was crazy! He never knew any animal was capable of such a thing! Still, when he really thought about it, this was probably the best meal he’s had in years… and he can at least call himself a ‘hunter’ now. “You’re…” He sheepishly admitted. “You’re in my… stomach…”

There was a pause as she realized he was telling the truth. “N-no!” At this, the impala started to panic, doing her best to struggle despite just how tightly his belly was squeezing around her body. “Please! Let me out! I-I don’t want to be… digested!” Simba let out another groan. Every single little movement the impala managed to make was like getting a belly rub from the inside. At this point, he was getting used to it, and it actually felt pretty great.

“Whoa. I didn’t know you lions could do that!” Suddenly, he tensed up when he’s startled by a voice nearby! He looks up to see that hyena looking at him, her eyes wide, her jaw practically dropping the floor! “That was, like, the coolest thing I’ve seen all year!” Apparently, she had been watching the entire spectacle in awe!

“Hey, you!” He tried to reach up and grab the intruder… but he quickly ran into a problem. He couldn’t even sit up! The weight in his belly was far too immense for him to anything other than lie here. All he could do was lie there and yell at her. “You’re not allowed on the pride lands! Get out of here!”

She giggled, walking up, and he let out a grunt as she planted a paw on his huge, round, fluffy gut. “What are you gonna do about it?” She laughs, looking down at his face with a toothy grin. “Looks to me like you’re sorta stuck here!”

“You KNOW what I can do about it!” He growled, pointing to his gut. “When I see you again, I can just… swallow you whole!” She did look a little frightened as she considered this. The thought of being digested wasn’t particularly pleasant… still, she was smart. She could figure out some sort of… compromise.

“Well... what if I start bringing you more snacks like this?” The hyena offered.

Simba paused, confused. “What do ya mean?”

“Well, doesn’t she feel good in there? And wasn’t she tasty?” The hyena asked. To butter him up, she got on her knees in front of him, and started gently massaging her belly. Simba had to admit, it did feel pretty great... “I know you male lions are too lazy to hunt… and you can’t leave the pride lands, either… so… what if, from now on, you just name a species - any species - and I’ll lure a tasty snack right to your door, help you swallow ‘em, and even give you a big belly massage afterwards…”

That sounds… amazing! But he knew he shouldn’t trust a hyena. “What’s in it for me?” He asked. As they talked, the impala could still faintly be heard begging for mercy, but her cries fell on deaf ears.

“Well, I like it on the Pride Lands. I just need you to promise not to eat me… and to help hide the fact that I’m here..” She got a big, smug grin on her face. “Sounds reasonable, right? Interested?”

They'd never let him get away with it.

French Fry sighed, leaning up against the nearest object, a black oil lamp. He looked up at the night sky, and wished that no one knew what he was capable of, so he could fatten and eat them.

"Wish granted," Jafar said, smirking down at French Fry. "Even Jumba has forgotten your particular abilities, old boy. Go on that retreat, and have fun."

French Fry blinked, and looked at the lamp. A slow smile formed on French Fry's face as he remembered that Jafar was a genie. He touched the lamp, and wished that he had been brought on the trip with the other Disney villains.

1213321.content:
Kim Possible and Ron Stoppable were airlifted into the African jungle by the military helicopter, which landed in an open field.

"Thanks again for this, General," said Kim, smiling.

"No problem. I owe you for rescuing my son's husband from the KKK," the grizzled old man piloting the chopper said.

"No big," Kim said. "It was the right thing to do."

"I wish more people were like you two," the general chuckled. "Just call me when you're ready to come back! You sure you don't need equipment?"

Ron smiled, holding up a pair of backpacks as he got out of the helicopter. "Got everything right hereaWHUP!" he said, slipping on a cable and falling out onto his face. Kim giggled, helping her lover up.

"Seriously, General, we came prepared," Kim said. "Thanks muchly!"

The general sighed wistfully. "Ah, if only my own daughter could be as respectful as you," he said, saluting her. "Call me on that nifty comm of yours when you need me. You have our frequency."

The general took off, leaving the two adventurers behind. Ron's pet molerat, Rufus, appeared out of a pocket. "Stinky," he commented.

Ron nodded, snorting at the air. "With you on that, buddy. Like the men's restroom at Bueno Nacho after Taquito Supremo night..."

Kim rolled her eyes. "I don't like the smell either, but we need to be here. Adrena Lynn's supposedly looking for a dangerous ancient artifact here, one that could make her nearly unstoppable. We obviously don't want her to get it."

Ron nodded. "Yeah, yeah. Weird how she resurfaced after so long. I thought after the first time you beat her she got the hint," he said.

Kim shrugged. "Guess she finally found a new thrill," she said. "C'mon!"

Ron grabbed her by the shoulder. "Wait. Should we take that thing that Wade insisted we bring with us?"

Kim blinked. "What, the acid protection thing?" Wade Load, their tech expert, had insisted that they take it. On their last mission, Drakken and Shego had come FRIGHTENINGLY close to killing them, dunking them in a pool of acid. Drakken had started to listen to Shego's advice, and was abandoning old villain cliches. The two baddies had removed all their equipment and put Rufus in a cage, ready to watch them melt. If Shego's heroic brothers hadn't been following Kim and Ron, they would have been killed...

Rufus shivered at the memory and went into the backpacks, pulling out the two vials. Kim took hers and looked at it. "I admit it's a good idea, but how likely are we gonna face acid on this adventure?" Kim said.

Ron frowned. "Kim... You know I love you, and how courageous you are, but we came so close last time... I don't wanna chance it."

Kim sighed. "Yeah... Yeah, we did..." she said softly.

Both Ron and Kim opened the syringes and injected themselves in the neck. They felt a brief tingle as the nanotechs inside the formula went to work, making their bodies completely resistant to any and all form of acid, inside and out.

"Besides," Ron quipped. "We're in the jungle. You never know when something might eat us."

Kim giggled. "C'mon, let's go." The two set off again, Rufus complaining under his breath that there was no formula for him...
1213321.title: The Kimventure Continues...

choices: Kim and Ron arrive at the temple, confronting Adrena Lynn...
Adrena Lynn's troops find them first...
12133211.content:
"KP?" Ron asked.

"Yeah?" Kim replied.

"We're lost, aren't we?" Ron asked.

Kim sighed. They had been wandering through the jungle for over an hour now, and hadn't come any closer to the temple Adrena Lynn was supposed to be at. "It's looking like it..."

"Lost forever!" Rufus moaned, fainting off of Ron's shoulder and into his hands.

Kim shook her head. "None of that," she said. "We just have to get our bearings and..." She peered ahead. "Ah. An indiginous village. We can use this as a landmark."

Ron's stomach growled. "I wonder if they have anything to eat..." he muttered.

"Maybe cheese?" Rufus asked.

"You're the one who ate all our cheese from our rations in the first ten minutes," Ron griped.

Kim giggled. "No, let's not disturb them," she said, looking over the thatch huts in the small valley. "We still have some rations left. We can just go around it."

"I don't think that's possible, Kim..." Ron said, suddenly sounding tense.

"Why's that, Ron?" Kim asked.

"..." Ron said, giggling nervously.

Kim sighed. "How many?"

"Too many," Ron said. "Pretty sure the biggest of them could bench press Warmonga..."

Kim turned slowly, frowning. The two of them had been surrounded by beautiful, powerfully muscled women with ample breasts and dark skin, their bodies nude save for green paint to help them blend in with the jungle. The tallest one, indeed as large as Warmonga as Ron had said, was wielding swords and glaring at Ron, Rufus, and Kim. Kim grinned nervously.

///////////
Later...
///////////

"I am sorry for earlier," the shaman of the tribe, a fat, older woman who was still very beautiful said. "We thought you were with that wretched Adrena Lynn person."

"So not the drama," Kim said, smiling, she and Ron eagerly eating the pulled pork dishes they had been given. "Not a lot of white people come out this way, I suspect. It's natural to think they may be together."

"I wish you luck on defeating her," the shaman said. "She disrupts the natural order of the place simply by being here. Our nameless god does not approve."

"Nameless god?" Kim asked.

The shaman nodded. "We are a people without names. Our tribe has existed for centuries, although sadly we are dying out. You saw that we have no men in our village?"

Kim nodded, glancing over to Ron, who was still eating. Rufus sat on Ron's lap, eating cheese provided by the villagers. Several of the village women, young and old, were looking at Ron with intense interest, although to Kim's relief he was oblivious. She took a bite of her pork, and said, "I have. What happened?"

"White man came, tried to civilize us. We learned their language, and sent them on their way. But lately, the men had been thinking about joining the world at large, taking names. Our nameless god disapproved, and struck all the men down with disease..."

Kim didn't really believe in gods, but she could understand losing people to plague. "I'm sorry..." she said.

Ron looked tense. "I'm sorry to seem insensitive, but am I in any danger from said disease?" he asked, Rufus looking at the shaman nervously.

The shaman chuckled. "You, especially you, have nothing to fear, child," she said.

Kim frowned at the way that was phrased. Ron was mollified by it, though. "Still..." Kim said, finishing her meal. "Thank you for hosting us. This was really good."

Ron finished off his meal, the three bowls of meat he had eaten set aside. Kim had eaten two bowls, which surprised herself. "Great stuff," Ron said.

The shaman smiled. "The one who gave of herself for that would be glad to hear it."

Ron, Rufus, and Kim froze. "Um... say again?"

"The warrior, the large one, who brought you in," the shaman said. "She was your meal. The cheese your small friend ate? Was made from breast milk of our women."

Ron whimpered, clutching his stomach. Rufus looked ill. Kim gulped hard. "You told me... that it was pork..."

The shaman grinned wickedly. "I did not lie. It was pork. Fresh longpork. And you both ate so heartily..."

"Oh my god..." Kim groaned, feeling nauseous.

Ron laughed madly. "OKAY THEN. Time to go. Thanks for the hospitality! May we never meet again!" Scooping up Rufus into a pocket, he and Kim prepared to flee the village. Before they could, the shaman grabbed them both by the arm, forcing them to look her in the eyes.

"Here me, children! Our nameless god has CHOSEN YOU! Ron Stoppable, you will be his avatar! Our death will come at your hands! Kim Possible, you will be his high priestess! You shall choose four more to serve Ron as he consumes for our god!" the shaman crowed. "The end of all things begins when you call us to your side!"

Rufus leaped out and bit the shaman's hand, making her let go of Kim and Ron. The three took the time to flee the village, the shaman's laughter following them as they ran back into the jungle. They didn't stop until they couldn't see the village at all anymore, both of them stopping to retch.

"Can't believe... we ate human meat..." Kim groaned.

"Does this make us cannibals?" Ron asked, grimacing.

Kim shook her head. "No. No, we didn't know what we were eating, and we have no plans to eat any more, right?"

"Right," Ron said, nodding. Rufus nodded in agreement.

Kim nodded. "So let's find Adrena Lynn, take out our frustrations on her, and then get the hell out of this jungle..." she said.

"I'm all for that," Ron said.

"Amen..." Rufus added.

The three of them trudged on. "...You're thinking about how good the meat was, aren't you?" Ron asked.

Kim whimpered. "Please drop it," she said.

It was a heroic battle between Shego and Kim Possible, with her partner Ron Stoppable (and pet naked molerat Rufus) in tow. The two were holding their own against Shego, who had kidnapped several women. She had been in the process of removing them when Kim and Ron showed up.

"Um... Shego?" Kim Possible asked as she battled her nemesis.

"Hm?" Shego said, firing a green laser blast at Kim, forcing to dodge.

"...What the hell are you wearing?" Kim asked, launching a kick at Shego's head.

13432.content:
Sonic, normally, was very careful when he ran. He didn't act it, but he was very intelligent about his speed and where he ran. He had to be, otherwise he'd crash into things and die horribly and in great pain. So he was very observent when dashing along at the speed of sound. He used his observational powers to do his amazing stunts, bouncing and flying off of everything.

However, not even Sonic could account for everything. So it can be excused that he didn't notice the stone falling from the sky and landing right in his path. He tripped over it, bouncing into a shallow pool. Frantic, he scrambled out of the water, glaring back at it.

"Freakin' hate water... Any water that's not in a drinking glass can go to hell..." he muttered. He looked around for what tripped him, spotting the meteorite in a crater.

"Huh..." he said, walking over to it. Cautiously, he reached out to touch it. Surprisingly, despite the re-entry, it was cool to the touch. "Weird..." He picked it up, and looked at it. It was glowing slightly, with a rune in the shape of a double-sphere, the smaller sphere with a hole in it...

The stone flashed, disappearing. Sonic blinked, confused. "The fuck...?" he said, looking around. "That's odd... Where'd it go?"

What he didn't know was that the artifact he touched had merged with him. He was now an engine of destruction. All the artifact, now a permanent part of Sonic's body, was waiting for, was for him to choose how he would destroy the world.

"Well, whatever," Sonic said. "I'm hungry anyway." He smirked. "Maybe see how Amy's doin.' I'm in a good mood, might as well actually encourage her a little." He dashed off.

The artifact's limited intelligence pondered this. Food... and women? Food women? ...It could work with that. It had created devourers before. Sonic would devour the women of the world... But there were men as well. Men that could interfere with Sonic in his consumption of femalekind. ...Easy solution, turn the men into actual food items to fatten up the women. Give Sonic bigger meals. Yes, he could work with that...

Sonic dashed off to find a meal. As he passed through the town, he didn't notice as any man he came near was turned into a random foodstuff. Cakes, chilidogs, pizza slices, every male of any species he passed became a food item. The women he passed didn't notice the men's disappearance, having a sudden compulsion to eat the foodstuffs that appeared. Sonic didn't know it, but soon he would realize his new destiny as the devourer of the world...

1353322211.content:
His name was Asriel Dreemur. Although lately he went by Flowey, due to the fact that a failed attempt at ressurecting him had trapped him in the body of a flower.

He was soulless, and as such held little in the way of actual emotion. He could feel amusement, disgust, fear... and anger. Anger at his family for seemingly abandoning each other. Anger at humanity for killing him and his friend/brother Chara. Anger at his fellow monsters for being so weak.

There was another thing he could feel - the desire to kill.

And DETERMINATION.

Determination was a mysterious thing. The vast majority of monsters lacked it, a monster with Determination only showing up in a once in a zillion chance. Mostly it was humans who had the power of Determination, the ability and will to control their own lives. For Flowey, this manifested in the ability to reset time to a certain point. And oh, did he abuse it. Over and over again, he would reset time, doing something different each time. Sometimes he would befriend, be the benevolent flower everyone liked. Sometimes he would butcher everyone just for fun, and bathe in their dust, for monsters turned to dust when slain.

He could never completely finish off every monster, though. Always, he would be defeated by Sans the Skeleton. The short, chubby-aura'd skeleton was quick with the puns (much to his younger, taller brother's dismay) and had a love of ketchup. He was also pathetically weak, only capable of taking a single strong hit before dying. Even his attacks were weak, only capable of inflicting a single health point of damage.

Sans was also the FASTEST monster in the underground, capable of attacking a million times a minute with bone weapons or the deadly Gaster Blasters, demonic skeletal heads that fired beams of light. Plus, he knew the magic of Karma, a poisonous aura who's intensity grew depending on what someone's Level Of ViolencE was. Each single strike would cause the poison. And because Sans could attack so fast, and Flowey's LOVE was so high whenever the two fought, the flower died to him each and every time. No matter what Flowey did, no matter how many resets he made, Sans would always adapt, dodge, and attack.

So many times Flowey had encountered Sans, that Sans was starting to not trust Flowey upon seeing him. He never knew why, he just had a feeling that Flowey wasn't to be trusted.

Flowey, realizing that the constant battling with Sans was starting to resonate with the skeleton and make him start to be aware of the time loops, backed off from genocide attempts for now.

One day, after a reset, something different happened.

He woke up as Asriel Dreemur instead of Flowey. And in the handsome adult body he gained from absorbing Chara's freely given soul. He went to a mirror, staring at himself. He was a handsome goatman, with long, curving horns and glowing black eyes. He was buff, as physically fit as a royal guard. And more than that... he had his own soul back. He was himself again.

He laughed. He couldn't help it. He could FEEL, truly FEEL again. And he felt wonderful.

But wait... "Chara?" he said, reaching out with his powerful magical senses. He couldn't sense his adopted brother anywhere, not even in himself. So why did he have the power gained from absorbing Chara? Had his constant tweaking with the timeline started to warp things?

He blinked, and checked something. He could feel that he still had the power to reset, but that it had changed somehow. Curious...

He looked around, noticing that he was in what looked like his old bedroom, albeit sized up to his current proportions. And there was a crown on his bedside table. His father's crown.

Uh oh...

"Not a good sign," he said. He could remember the times he fought Asgore as the soulless Flowey and regretted all of them. Quickly dressing in robes similar to the ones his mother usually wore, hesitating for a moment and putting on the crown as well, he went outside... and noticed how things had changed. The castle was much more opulent, more regal... and it was on the surface.

He stared, stunned as the sun poured through the marble columns. He could feel the heat of the sun, something he thought he'd never see again, and for a moment was lost...

He looked down over the crowd, seeing monsters walking freely through what looked like a human village. The monsters waved to him happily when they saw him, Asriel numbly waving back. A few humans were there, but they wore collars and didn't look any monster in the eye. Some were on leashes.

"Whoa..." Asriel said. "Did... did we conquer the humans in this timeline?"

He turned at the sound of cheering, and saw a male catman, one Asriel recognized as the rather overworked, underpaid Burgerpants, gulping down a female human whole and alive. Her legs were kicking wildly as she descended down Burgerpants throat, his stomach bulging out heavily as he ate her. Around him, a crowd of other monsters was cheering him, egging him on as if he were chugging a keg. Once the human's legs completely vanished down his throat, her feet the last thing to enter him, he let out a belching, making a mic drop motion. The crowd cheered, patting him on the back.

Asriel grinned. "So we own humans now... Cool. Never liked them. Except for Chara..."

And then he noticed the statue in the center of town.

It was Asgore Dreemur, his father, posing heroically with his trident. Asriel enhanced his vision with a magic spell, and read the inscription on the farway statue.

"In Loving Memory of King Asgore Dreemur, who sacrificed his life to free monsters from human oppression."

Asriel staggered, dispelling the vision spell. Somehow, a timeline had been born where his father and monsterkind had won the war, at the cost of Asgore's life. Which meant he was king now...

He went inside and sat down on his bed, thinking about the number of timelines where he, as Flowey, had slain his father, had mocked him... and he wept. For what felt like hours but was in fact only one, he mourned his lost opportunities to be a good son. Finally, he resolved to be a good king in this timeline in his father's memory, to make that his apology. He would never reset again.

Besides, eating that human had looked like fun.
1353322211.title: Hail to the King

It was a race. One that Sly felt he had to win.

Neyla, who had somehow survived the death of Clock-La, wanted the artifact for the resale value. With the rumors and mythology behind, she felt she could make a fortune off of it by selling it to the right buyers.

Carmelita, ever the policewoman, had been tricked by a man claiming to be the last descendant of the the people who made the artifact, was going after it to retrieve it for him. Little did she know that the man was actually a corrupt businessman who wanted the power of the artifact for himself.

Sly Cooper, greatest thief in the world (although he'd give equal shares of the credit to his gang), wanted it because he knew the creator was his old nemesis Clockwerk. His team's resident genius had verified that the mythology behind the artifact was true. And Sly knew that the only safe place for it was locked away in the deepest, darkest corner of the Cooper Vault.

"Ladies, really, if you'll just back off, I'll happily put the artifact in a safe place," Sly said as the three of them raced through the ruins.

Carmelita responded with a shot from her shock pistol. "Cooper, the Amulet of Glor belongs to its current family descendant," she insisted. "I'm not letting either of you get it."

"Gotta stop us first, Ironsides," Neyla cackled. The three of them were running almost side by side, dodging and rolling through the ruins, avoiding columns, cracked floors, and the like. Sly's agility was such that he was almost running along the ceiling, Carmelita's powerful jumps making it seem like she was flying. Neyla's whipwork got her through more than one obstacle. "What do you say, Cooper? If you get it first, we split the profits?"

"That thing's going to be locked away in the Cooper Vault. Preferably under a rock. Surrounded by claymores," Sly said fiercely. "It's too dangerous to be outside."

"I'm sure the proper owner will..." Carmelita started to say.

"Carm, I love you, but think. Couldn't your boy be lying?" Sly said.

The uncharacteristic seriousness was making both Carmelita and Neyla hesitate. "His references checked out..." Carmelita said.

"Bentley would whip up enough evidence to prove that I'm the king of Thailand. Doesn't mean I actually am," Sly said simply.

Carmelita, new possibilities starting to occur to her, began to slow down, doubt filling her.

"You'd really give up a profit like this?" Neyla asked him curiously.

"I've always stole for the challenge, mostly," Sly said. "But yeah. Getting that thing someplace where no one can use it is more important than a cash haul this time."

Now Neyla was starting to hesitate. "You don't really believe the myths behind that thing, do you?" she asked.

"This is my serious face, Neyla," Sly growled. "The only place that Amulet is going is in the Vault."

The three ran on, heading for the chamber where the Amulet awaited them.
13533222211.title: The Race to the Evil Treasure

choices: Sly is suddenly possessed by the Amulet's evil magic, attacking the two women...
Sly is fine for now, just in a LOT of pain...
135332222111.content:
The three racers ended up arriving in the chamber at the same time. Carmelita, Sly, and Neyla stared at the amulet, an obsidian mouth roughly the size of an Olympic medal. Staring at it, Neyla and Carmelita felt a chill go down their spines. And while Sly didn't feel the same sudden fear, he could feel the evil coming off of the Amulet. Sly and Carmelita both tried to contact their backup, but couldn't raise them this deep into the temple.

"Ladies, last chance," he said. "This thing is TOO DANGEROUS, and the Vault is the safest place in the world. Especially after Bentley upgraded the hell out of it."

Carmelita frowned. "...What's the story behind this thing, anyway?"

"Glor was a legendary criminal, but one who did his best to avoid noteriety. A wolf, he was responsible for the disappearances of hundreds of women over the years. Some reappeared as part of his personal harem, brainwashed beyond recovery. Most vanished, never to be found again. The general theory is that he sold them into slavery," Neyla said.

"Soul slavery, maybe," Sly muttered. "My team did some research on this guy. He was a magician, as powerful in magic as Clockwerk was in technology. And that amulet is the key to his power."

"Can't believe you believe in that stuff," Neyla said, although she had doubts. Something about this place...

"We've all seen magic," Sly insisted. "Neyla, you were possessed by the goddamn Clockwerk shell!"

"That's different," Neyla said. "And please don't remind me of that..."

"This... this is bad..." Carmelita said. "Something about this place..."

"The Amulet has to be contained, if not outright destroyed," Sly said. "It can't be trusted in ANYONE'S hands, and this temple isn't protection enough. We got here through freakin' parkour only, WHILE FIGHTING EACH OTHER." The master thief shook his head. "I'm sorry, ladies. But I'm gonna have to insist this time. The amulet is mine, and I'm gonna lock it away in the Cooper Vault."

"A MAN OF AMBITION HAS APPEARED," said a thundering voice.

"What... who said that?!" Carmelita said, aiming her shock pistol.

"It was the Amulet..." Neyla said, staring fearfully.

"What?!" Sly said, confused.

"LOOK!" Neyla shouted.

The Amulet of Glor was glowing. "A MAN OF AMBITION HAS APPEARED, AND LAY CLAIM TO MY POWER. AND THE HATED OWL IS NO LONGER IN THIS WORLD TO CHALLENGE ME."

"Oh shit..." Sly said, realizing.

"MAN OF AMBITION. I GRANT YOU MY POWER. THE WORLD BELONGS TO YOU NOW. USE IT AS YOU WILL," the voice from the Amulet said. Before any of the three could react, it flew off of its platform and slammed into Sly's chest, knocking him over. He screamed, clawing at his chest as his shirt vaporized from the impact of the amulet, which was now fusing itself into his skin and bone.

"SLY!" Carmelita and Neyla shouted, rushing to his side. They were rivals, but that didn't mean they couldn't care about him.

The magic faded after a long moment, Sly collapsing, gasping in pain. "Aaagh..." he moaned.

"Sly," Carmelita said. "Are you okay?"

"I don't..." Sly said, wincing as he slowly tried to stand up. "I don't know..."

1353322222222111.content:
It began quietly, far beyond the reach of the ears of Mortal Hylians, in the realm of the Gods. It was the home of the Three Goddesses, Din, Nayru, and Farore; the Golden Goddesses who forged Hyrule and left the Triforce as a token of their labors. And ever since, they had watched Hyrule from afar, silently observing the dealings of the mortals they created, in their efforts to gain control over the Triforce and the Sacred Realm they created. And for several generations, the three sisters quietly observed as those chosen by fate gained their respective pieces and waged war over the lands they'd created. And as this conflict continued for several generations, the Goddesses were quite amused. In a lot of ways, Hyrule was their favorite source of entertainment. But over the centuries as the various Legends that spawned from that land came and went, and how it seemed the same story repeated itself over and over...there was one thing all three of the goddesses could agree on.

"Oh for the love of ME, I'm bored," Din exclaimed laying back on her cloud.

"Hi Bored, I'm Farore; nice to meet you," her bubbly Sister said now leaning against her cloud, playfully pointing her tongue at her.

"Go back to sleep, Moss-for-Brains," Din said pushing Farore away.

"Aw she's just trying to cheer you up, Hot-Head," Nayru said as she put her harp to the side.

"I don't want to be cheered up," Din complained. "I want to be entertained."

"Well you could always watch reruns of what's been going on down in Hyrule, if you're so bored," Nayru said.

"That won't do any good," Din said. "It's actually the problem."

"How is it a problem?" Farore asked.

"To be quite frank, my dear sisters, the goings-on in Hyrule over the past few millennia have gotten stale and bland. I've encountered unsalted crackers with more flavor and variety than what Hyrule has been doing."

"What do you mean?" Nayru asked.

"Every single time, it's the same exact story," Din says. "Ganondorf shows up, causes some havoc and Link and Zelda team up to inevitably stop him. Sure there's subtle variations between each story, but those variations aren't enough to satisfy my tastes. I mean, you realize that in ONE timeline alone down there, the same story played itself out no less than THREE times!"

"If I recall, sister, the Imprisoning War Trifecta-Paradox was actually your fault," Nayru said.

"Yeah, you wanted to have at least ONE timeline where my Linkie-kins died, because you couldn't stand watching your Gan-Gan lose," Farore chimed in, before giggling to herself.

"Well I didn't expect the humans to be THAT incompetent without Link. I thought that the Sages would still be able to lock him away in the Sacred Realm even without the boy's help. I mean, he was standing RIGHT THERE, on the ruins of his castle, surrounded by a ring of fire. You're telling me that your Princess couldn't have blasted him with her magic right then and there?!"

"Zelly was a little distressed after she watched her beloved champion get killed," Nayru said rather smugly taking a sip of tea.

"It seems like that girl keeps ruining everything," Din said. "If it wasn't for her, we wouldn't even have this whole timeline problem."

"Wait, didn't we just establish that at least 1/3rd of this timeline problem is on you?" Farore said. "And besides, you actually preferred the timeline split, because it 'made things more interesting' as you put it."

"Just because I enjoyed the outcome doesn't mean I don't recognize that it's a problem," Din said getting defensive.

"Humph, well Excuuuuuuuse-" BONK!

Farore was cut-off mid-sentence by suddenly being struck in the face by a large frying pan, wielded by Din. The green haired Goddess fell to the ground in an unconscious heap.

"I told you, we NEVER speak of that, again," Din hissed.

"Me thinks you're a bit over stressed, Sister," Nayru asked.

"Well of course I'm over stressed; I'm bored out of my mind, desperate for some variety, and I keep watching this crystal ball, observing every minute detail of Hyrule just waiting for something to go back and liven things up a bit!"

Nayru finally stood up off her cloud and walked over to Din as she paced around the Viewing Globe in the center of their chamber.
"So what exactly do you propose we do about it?"

"Well...I've had an idea that I wanted to run past you guys," Din said. "I think it's time that we interfered again."

"Snort-Interfered?!" Farore said suddenly rising back to life.

"Oh not again, sister," Nayru said. "Hasn't our interference already done enough to these people? If anything, that little gift that we left down there for them turned out to be a major curse."

"C'mon girls...we're Goddesses here; they're mortals...They're temporary; we're eternal. I'm not going to sit around being bored for the rest of eternity. They should be honored that the Goddesses are using them for our amusement," Din reasoned. "Besides, think about all the other times we've interfered with them. We've always tipped the scales of balance in favor of either good or evil; I mean think about it - why did we allow Ganondorf to get the Triforce of Power, despite never having opened the Sacred Realm in the events of Twilight Princess?"

Without missing a beat, all three of the sisters uniformly said, "Boredom..."

"Right, and how about in the aftermath of Ocarina of Time in the Adult-Timeline," Din continued. "Why did we flood all of Hyrule when with a snap of our fingers, we could've just willed another Link into existence to stop Ganondorf?"

Once again, all three Goddesses said, "-for Kicks..."

"See? We've had fun messing with them before," Din said. "Let's do it again."

"You know, you have the weirdest method of coming up with names for these little episodes our chosen ones find themselves in," Nayru said.

"Yeah, kind of cooky; I wanna name the next one," Farore said.

"Oh alright; if you're so smart, what would you name one?" Din asked.

"How about...Breath of the Wild?" she asked. Din immediately smacked her on the back of the head.

"That name is stupid, you're stupid and you should feel stupid," Din said.

"How come I can't name any of them?" Nayru asked.

"Oh don't you start, Little-Girl-Blue," Din said. "We already let you name the collection of these stories after that Princess of yours. The ironic thing is, her importance to the story is that she keeps messing things up."

"She does not!" Nayru said.

"Girls, can we focus on the topic at hand?" Din asked raising a hand.

"Oh right; you wanna screw around with people's free-will, again," Farore said.

"Well not in so many words, but...I just want to set it on a course and see what happens. And if it doesn't work out, we'll just isolate the events from the rest of the timeline, snap our fingers, and everything goes back to normal. Deal?"

Nayru thought a moment. "Alright, what exactly do you want us to do?"

"Well, I thought up some ideas while I was browsing the internet the other day," Din said.

"Wait - the Internet? That thing that won't be invented for another few thousand years, by a completely different species, on a different planet, in another dimension?" Nayru asked.

"How'd you manage that?" Farore asked.

"Girls; we're beyond Space and Time - literally everything that will happen has already happened for us. Now -"

"Y'know, I just had a thought," Nayru said.

"Not now, Rue," Din said rolling her eyes. At this rate, it would never happen.

"If we're beyond Space and Time, how can we possibly exist? I mean, space is the plane in which matter can exist, and time is the plane in which action can take place. So if we're beyond Space and Time, it effectively means that we're made of nothing and can do nothing. So logically speaking how is that any different than - "

"NEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEERD!!!" Farore suddenly yelled pointing a finger at Nayru, stopping her in her tracks. It seemed to be the only way to stop her from going on an hour long existential tirade regarding their existence.

"Thank you, Bush-Hair," Din said.

"You're welcome, Sand-n-Salty," Farore chimed.

"So after a bit of browsing, I found some interesting concepts that mankind comes up with," Din said. "One of them is called 'Vore'."

"You mean the fascination or interest in one life-form eating another; usually whole and alive?" Nayru asked. "You want to expose OUR creation to the depravity of a fetish?"

"Oh come on, tell me that you haven't been curious about what would happen," Din said. "I think we should chose someone down in Hyrule to go on an eating spree - give them some BS morally simplistic reason - and order that they eat everyone they can."

"Sounds yucky," Farore said. "You're weird."

"Not everybody," Nayru said, now seemingly into the idea. "Maybe just...one specific type of people. There are quite a few notable women down there. Maybe it would be kind of interesting to see if our potential predator would be willing to eat them."

"Great, so you're on board," Din said. "I agree - only women shall be eaten. That way Ganondorf can remain out of the proceedings. Sides; those Gerudos have really had it coming as of late. So who is going to be our potential predator?"

"Linkie-kins of course," Farore said. "I don't want anyone eating him; so let's let him get in on the fun."

"Right; so Link," Nayru said. "Which one though? We need someone of the appropriate age; so Child and Toony are out."

"We need one that's handsome; so anything post A Link to the Past," Farore said.

"Which to choose," Din asked.
1353322222222111.title: An Order from the Gods

1353322222222312.content:
The Battle Royale! The contestants loved it. All the violence they wanted, and none of the death and pain. The contestants would lay in VR chambers that would broadcast holographic avatars of their bodies onto the island, anyone with superpowers losing said powers due to all the bodies having the same limitations, and they would fight to the last person (or team) standing to gain that victory.

The person running the battles, Dr. Vinderman (a business tycoon who controlled every global business and replaced all national currency with his Vbucks), noted the dichotomy. In the contest, the contestants were vicious, cruel, and unrelentingly violent in their attempts for victory. Use of guns was commonplace, but there would also be trends for kills. The hologram bodies felt only the slightest bit of pain and every bit of pleasure, so people would experiment in how to destroy each other. Choking, melee duels with pickaxes, drowning... one might worry for the mental health and well-being of each contestant.

Except for the fact that every contestant knew full well the games were just that. Games. Someone who brutally, savagely murdered someone with a pickaxe in the game would be casually chatting with them over breakfast. When questioned, the contestants all said the same thing - it was stress relief. Their own personal Purge, except not run by psychotic government officials and rich people wanting to kill off the poor.

And indeed, even the most vicious competitors were casual and friendly. The most that happened is that some contestants were having sex. So Dr. Vinderman, while still keeping an eye on his contestants, decided not to worry about it.

And then a rather surprising new trend came, one that all the female contestants supported.

It had started with Ramirez, one of the oldest contestants. The Battle Royale island was constantly shifting and warping due to the mystical, evil Storm and other elements. Locations would shift or be added, landscape would change... and occasionally there were invasions. Twice the alien warlord Thanos had attacked the island, looking for cosmic artifacts that Dr. Vinderman kept locked away in a vault. The second time he brought an alien army. And there had also been multiple attacks by zombies.

Ramirez, the first time she had been killed by those zombies (well, more zombie-like creatures than actual undead), had been eaten by them, pinned down and devoured. Because she only felt slight pain in her holographic body and all of her body's normal levels of pleasure, she had enjoyed it. She had deliberately fed herself to the zombies several times, enjoying it more and more every time. She had then tricked the werewolf Dire into swallowing her whole and digesting her.

It was bliss. She did research on it, learning about vore, Dolcett, and other fetishes involving someone getting eaten, and shared her experiences with the other female contestants, who got more and more into the idea. It would just be their holographic bodies getting eaten, and honestly, it was something new. So they convinced the male contestants to go along with it, and got Dr. Vinderman to make modifications to their holographic bodies.

Men could get fat now, at least in their hologram bodies, and swallow women whole. Women could be eaten, either cooked and cut up or gulped down whole. And a new contest variant was made.

The Hunt - Men on one team, women on another. Men won by eating all the women. Women won by eliminating all the men. While men would simply be eliminated once their health ran out, women would be put into a 'knocked down' state, like in team modes. This meant the woman was vulnerable to being captured and turned into food. Once captured, the woman was to be considered just 'meat,' meaning the men could do what they want with her. (Surprisingly, the female contestants had insisted on this, wanting to add to the thrill.) If the men were killed mid-meal, the woman could eat the 'meat' of her fellow contestant to get healed. Grills, ovens, and cooking tools had been added all over the island, and the Storm would come in extremely slow compared to other battles.

The game was made, and everything was ready. And while the contestants assured Dr. Vinderman they'd keep it in the game, as always, he still added security around the residential island. Just in case.

135332222222233333311.content:
Junko Enoshima didn't like surprises. She liked things to go the way she wanted to. So when the girls of her class and another class were suddenly put together in the same class, she put her plans to brainwash her fellow students and cause the apocalypse on hold. She glanced around, seeing who all was there. Each one was an expert in their field, and in their own way as talented as Junko herself.

Sayaka Maizono, the Ultimate Pop Idol
Kyoko Kirigiri, the Ultimate Detective
Aoi Asahina, the Ultimate Swimming Pro
Toko Fukawa, the Ultimate Writing Prodigy
Sakura Ogami, the Ultimate Martial Artist
The girl who called herself Celestia Ludenberg, the Ultimate Gambler
Chiaki Nanami, the Ultimate Gamer
Akane Owari, the Ultimate Gymnast
Sonia Nevermind, the Ultimate Princess
Hiyoko Saionji, the Ultimate Traditional Dancer
Mahiru Koizumi, the Ultimate Photographer
Mikan Tsumiki, the Ultimate Nurse
Ibuki Mioda, the Ultimate Musician
Peko Pekoyama, the Ultimate Swordsman
Junko's sister, Mukuro Ikusaba, the Ultimate Soldier
And of course, Junko herself, the Ultimate Fashionista. (Although personally, she wanted to be known as the Ultimate Despair.)

The fluffy-haired pinkette looked around, assessing everyone. Junko was a brilliant psychoanalyst, having used her abilities to manipulate so many people in the past. Even now, as class began, she could sense things establishing themselves. Peko was clearly unhappy about being away from the man she was supposed to guard. Aoi and Sakura had forged a bond rather quickly, while a friendly rivalry was forming between Akane and Sakura. Hiyoko was proving to be a troll, enjoying the chaos developing around her, while Mikan was meekly hiding in a corner.

Celestia was glaring at Junko, Junko having slipped the Ultimate Gambler a note with Celestia's real name on it. Junko smirked at her, holding her hand over her phone, ready to text the name to everyone. Celestia flinched and looked away, Junko knowing that she had a minion now.

Mukuro leaned over to Junko. "Sis? What do you think happened?"

"Like, I don't know," Junko muttered. "Let's just play it cool for now. Go with the flow until I get a feel for things."

Mukuro nodded, sitting back in her chair. As if on cue, the door opened, the girls who were standing quickly sitting back down. To their surprise, though, a heavily fat man waddled in, his great, fat gut spilling out of his shirt. He smelled lightly of roses, but looked, quite frankly, like a slob. He wore a jacket that barely fit his fat arms, and his shirt rode up to reveal his gut, which hung down over his waist. His moobs were as big as the breasts of some of the smaller-chested girls, and he had a massive rump that jiggled in the sweatpants he wore. His face was heavily bearded, the man's complexion revealing him as an American. He smiled, adjusting his glasses.

"BWWOAAARRRP! Excuse me," the man said. "Just making some staff adjustments. Anyway, I'm Mr. Bluto, and I'll be your teacher from now on."

Junko snickered softly, her nose twitching as she took in his scent. What a slob, she thought. Although she found herself unable to look away from him feeling oddly fascinated with the huge, fat oaf...
